3.13. Domains for which Ll,p(Ω) ∩L∞(Ω) is a Banach algebra
Let Ω be a domain in Rn. We may ask whether the space Ll,p(Ω) ∩L∞(Ω) is
an algebra with respect to pointwise multiplication. Clearly, this is the case
for l = 1. Since Stein’s extension operator from a Lipschitz graph domain Ω
is continuous as an operator
Ll,p(Ω) ∩L∞(Ω) → Ll,p(Rn) ∩L∞(Rn),
the above question has the affirmative answer for the union of a finite number
of Lipschitz graph domains. For example, Ω can be a bounded domain having
the cone property. However, by a counterexample proposed in [80] (see also
[69, p. 120-121]), it turns out that the space Ll,p(Ω) ∩L∞(Ω) is generally not
an algebra.
Problem. Find a necessary and sufficient condition on Ω ⊂ Rn ensuring that
Ll,p(Ω) ∩ L∞(Ω) is a Banach algebra.
